entity.name: Yet Another Society d/b/a The Perl and Raku Foundation
entity.description: The Perl & Raku Foundation (TPRF) is a US 501(c)(3) non-profit dedicated to the advancement of the Perl and Raku programming languages through open discussion, collaboration, design, and code. TPRF acts as legal steward for the Perl and Raku trademarks and the Artistic License. The foundation funds core language development and community projects through its grants programmes, organises The Perl and Raku Conference, supports community infrastructure including CPAN, MetaCPAN, perl.org, and PerlMonks, and participates in outreach programmes such as Outreachy.

projects.name: Perl Core Development Fund
projects.description: Funding for development and maintenance of the Perl core through grants to core developers, guided by the Perl Steering Council. Originally established in 2008 with support from Booking.com as the Perl 5 Core Maintenance Fund, relaunched in 2020 as the Perl Core Development Fund. Grants are awarded to contributors endorsed by core committers, with monthly progress reporting and open source release requirements.

projects.name: Raku Development Fund
projects.description: Funding for development and improvement of the Raku language specification and implementations. Originally created in 2015 as the Perl 6 Development Fund, relaunched in 2020 as the Raku Development Fund. Grants are awarded to contributors endorsed by the Raku Steering Council. All funded work is released under the Artistic License 2.0.

projects.name: Community Grants Programme
projects.description: General grants programme funding projects that benefit the wider Perl and Raku communities. Covers core language improvements, documentation, tutorials, libraries, and tooling. The Grants Committee opens a call for proposals every two months, with public feedback and committee evaluation. Grant recipients provide monthly progress reports and release all work as open source.
